snippet: Television reports showed two antiriot vehicles moving along a street and firing water cannons at groups calling for a recount.
abstract: Police in Ankara, Turkey, use water cannons and stun grenades to disperse crowds protesting voting irregularities in one of closest races in local elections, which brought landslide victory for Islamic-rooted governing party.
lead_paragraph: Television reports showed two antiriot vehicles moving along a street and firing water cannons at groups calling for a recount.

headline.main: Turkey: Police Break Up Protest Over Voting Irregularities
headline.print_headline: Turkey: Police Break Up Protest Over Voting Irregularities
